list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Fix test class issues and update constructor calls in BookServiceTest
- Corrected constructor calls in BookServiceTest to match the available constructors in the Book class. - Cleaned up imports in BookServiceTest and UserServiceTest to resolve ambiguous import issues. - Ensured that only JUnit 4 dependencies are used in the test classes for consistency. - Verified that all tests now compile and run correctly.

task.summary:
Add unit tests for BookService class
- Implemented tests for searchBook, purchaseBook, addBookReview, addBook, and removeBook methods. - Included positive, negative, and edge case scenarios. - Utilized JUnit for test assertions and Mockito for mocking dependencies. - Ensured tests run independently with proper setup and teardown methods.

Add unit tests for UserService class
- Implemented tests for registerUser, loginUser, and updateUserProfile methods. - Covered positive, negative, and edge case scenarios. - Utilized JUnit for assertions to validate method behavior. - Ensured comprehensive testing of user registration, login, and profile update functionalities.

Add unit tests for UserService class
- Implemented tests for registerUser, loginUser, and updateUserProfile methods. - Covered positive, negative, and edge case scenarios. - Utilized JUnit for assertions to validate method behavior. - Ensured comprehensive testing of user registration, login, and profile update functionalities.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd"> <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
<groupId>org.example</groupId> <artifactId>JunitProject</artifactId> <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
<properties> <maven.compiler.source>11</maven.compiler.source> <maven.compiler.target>11</maven.compiler.target> <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding> </properties>
<dependencies> <!-- JUnit 4 dependency --> <dependency> <groupId>junit</groupId> <artifactId>junit</artifactId> <version>4.13.2</version> <scope>test</scope> </dependency>
<!-- Mockito dependency --> <dependency> <groupId>org.mockito</groupId> <artifactId>mockito-core</artifactId> <version>3.12.4</version> <scope>test</scope> </dependency>
<!-- Additional testing dependencies --> <dependency> <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId> <artifactId>junit-jupiter</artifactId> <version>RELEASE</version> <scope>test</scope> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>org.testng</groupId> <artifactId>testng</artifactId> <version>RELEASE</version> <scope>test</scope> </dependency> </dependencies>
</project>

Update pom.xml to include JUnit 4 and Mockito dependencies
- Added JUnit 4 dependency (junit:junit:4.13.2) for unit testing. - Added Mockito dependency (org.mockito:mockito-core:3.12.4) for mocking in tests. - Retained existing dependencies for JUnit Jupiter and TestNG. - Ensured compatibility with JUnit 4 tests in the project.

Fix test class issues and update constructor calls in BookServiceTest
- Corrected constructor calls in BookServiceTest to match the available constructors in the Book class. - Cleaned up imports in BookServiceTest and UserServiceTest to resolve ambiguous import issues. - Ensured that only JUnit 4 dependencies are used in the test classes for consistency. - Verified that all tests now compile and run correctly.

- Implemented tests for registerUser, loginUser, and updateUserProfile methods. - Covered positive, negative, and edge case scenarios. - Utilized JUnit for assertions to validate method behavior. - Ensured comprehensive testing of user registration, login, and profile update functionalities.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd"> <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
<groupId>org.example</groupId> <artifactId>JunitProject</artifactId> <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
<properties> <maven.compiler.source>11</maven.compiler.source> <maven.compiler.target>11</maven.compiler.target> <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding> </properties>
<dependencies> <!-- JUnit 4 dependency --> <dependency> <groupId>junit</groupId> <artifactId>junit</artifactId> <version>4.13.2</version> <scope>test</scope> </dependency>
<!-- Mockito dependency --> <dependency> <groupId>org.mockito</groupId> <artifactId>mockito-core</artifactId> <version>3.12.4</version> <scope>test</scope> </dependency>
<!-- Additional testing dependencies --> <dependency> <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId> <artifactId>junit-jupiter</artifactId> <version>RELEASE</version> <scope>test</scope> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>org.testng</groupId> <artifactId>testng</artifactId> <version>RELEASE</version> <scope>test</scope> </dependency> </dependencies>
</project>

Update pom.xml to include JUnit 4 and Mockito dependencies
- Added JUnit 4 dependency (junit:junit:4.13.2) for unit testing. - Added Mockito dependency (org.mockito:mockito-core:3.12.4) for mocking in tests. - Retained existing dependencies for JUnit Jupiter and TestNG. - Ensured compatibility with JUnit 4 tests in the project.

Fix test class issues and update constructor calls in BookServiceTest
- Corrected constructor calls in BookServiceTest to match the available constructors in the Book class. - Cleaned up imports in BookServiceTest and UserServiceTest to resolve ambiguous import issues. - Ensured that only JUnit 4 dependencies are used in the test classes for consistency. - Verified that all tests now compile and run correctly.
